page.title: 10Service Provision
page.content: The demand for 'local' shops selling convenience goods has declined even though the population has risen. People travel to Cheltenham, Gloucester, and Tewkesbury for major entertainments. Primary schools are found in Bishops Cleeve, Treddington, and Gotherington (all on the edge of the survey area). Older children (aged 11 to 18 years) attend the comprehensive school in Bishops Cleeve. Many children are taken to and from school by two local bus companies; Perretts of Andoversford and Marchants of Cheltenham. For many children, having to catch the bus at the end of the school day prevents them from taking part in out of school activities. Public transport to the larger villages is generally good.
